meanings.definition: A pit or hollow in which liquid collects, especially one in the bottom of a mine or on a ship.
meanings.sent1: The miners had to pump out the water that accumulated in the sump.
meanings.sent2: The ship's sump was full of rainwater after the storm.
meanings.sent3: The sump in the mine decided to take a break and fill up with water.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like a sump, collecting all the tears shed in sorrow.
meanings.sent5: The sump in the basement was so deep, it seemed bottomless.

meanings.definition: A reservoir or chamber at the bottom of a machine, used to collect and store fluids.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic checked the sump of the engine for any leaks.
meanings.sent2: The oil sump of the car needed to be drained and refilled.
meanings.sent3: The sump in the machine was so full, it looked like it might overflow with oil.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a sump, storing memories and thoughts like precious fluids.
meanings.sent5: The sump in the factory was a vital part of the production process, ensuring smooth operation.
